sentences.text: I know you've been looking forward to this part.
You're now about to learn the best ways of moving to the rear court in badminton, which is super fun.
Going through these videos will completely change how you play at the back of the court.
Do you ever find yourself struggling, being put under pressure or caught out at the back of the court?
Well, by the end of the next two lessons, you'll be able to take back control, developing an aggressive and explosive play style.
I'm going to split these lessons up into the forehand and backhand corner.
But unlike the front of the court, where the movements are very similar here, they're actually quite different.
That being said, there are still some parallels between the forehand and backhand side.
There's one movement pattern for when you get behind the shuttle and play aggressively.
There's another movement pattern for when you're under pressure and forced to play a defensive shot.
And then there's an option that's in between the two.
Again, that's probably why there is so much conflicting information going around.
It's not necessarily because one person is right and then other people are wrong.
There's just so much information that it's very difficult to cover it all and give a full explanation.
For the first time, all this information has been succinctly package into the next two lessons.
This is going to give you a huge advantage over the competition.
We'll start off on the forehand side.
